title: 2000 UEFA Super Cup
text:
The 2000 UEFA Super Cup was a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> match played on 25 August 2000 between <a href="Real%20Madrid%20CF">Real Madrid</a> of Spain and <a href="Galatasaray%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Galatasaray</a> of Turkey. Real Madrid qualified by beating <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia</a> in the <a href="2000%20UEFA%20Champions%20League%20Final">2000 UEFA Champions League Final</a>, while Galatasaray had made it to the Super Cup after beating <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> in the <a href="2000%20UEFA%20Cup%20Final">2000 UEFA Cup Final</a>. Galatasaray won the match 2–1, both goals scored by <a href="M%C3%A1rio%20Jardel">Mário Jardel</a>, the latter a <a href="golden%20goal">golden goal</a>.
This was the first Super Cup contested by the winners of the UEFA Cup (now the <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a>). Until 1999, it was contested by the winners of the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> and the winners of the <a href="UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">UEFA Cup Winners' Cup</a>, but the Cup Winners' Cup was discontinued after the 1998–99 season.
Venue.
The <a href="Stade%20Louis%20II">Stade Louis II</a> in <a href="Monaco">Monaco</a> has been the venue for the UEFA Super Cup since 1998. It was built in 1985, and is also the home of <a href="AS%20Monaco%20FC">AS Monaco</a>, who play in the French league system.
